Radical Self-defense

While there are many social prisoners whose cases would fall under the heading of self-defense, prisoners in this category listed on this site are those who participated in social movement prior to their incarceration and in many cases are from the LGBTQI community and/or obviously had the court biased against them.

Tabitha Brubaker

Tabitha Brubaker was arrested for her alleged involvement in a physical altercation with "Brother Dean Sexton", an inflammatory street preacher with a long history of targeting and harassing women and LGBTQI folks, often with a sign reading "You Deserve to be Raped." Brother Dean is part of the Campus Ministry USA, a traveling church that goes to high schools and colleges around the country preaching hate-filled rhetoric.

  • Read more about Tabitha Brubaker
  • Add new comment

Luke O'Donovan

On New Year’s Eve of 2013, Luke O’Donovan attended a house party in Reynoldstown, a neighborhood in Atlanta, Georgia. Luke was seen dancing with and kissing other men at the party. Later in the night he was insulted with homophobic slurs, and attacked by several people at once. Luke unsuccessfully attempted to escape, at which point several witnesses reported watching between 5 and 12 men ganging-up on Luke and stomping on his head and body, evidently with the intent to kill him. Luke was called a faggot before and during the attack.

  • Read more about Luke O'Donovan
  • Add new comment

Fran Thompson

Serving life plus 10 years for killing a man who broke into her home in self-defense. Before her imprisonment, Fran was an eco, animal & anti-nuke campaigner and it is believed this biased the court against her.

  • Read more about Fran Thompson
  • Add new comment
